p.s: Brian Pollard uses a lot of stylistic devices to make the reader agree to his opinion that unions are no longer usefulluseful.
In the following text I will analyse them.

The first stylistic device aan enumeration can be found in line 3 to 4 here the needed changes are lined next to eachothereach other they also needed better working conditions, shorter working days and higher wages, the author uses the enumeration to show all the good things that the unions did for the workers, he does that to show how much the unions have changed.

The author also uses another enumeration in line 7 to 8 good working conditions, good wages and safe working environment this enumeration shows that the workers now have the things they needed before.

The author uses a language device he often talks about how the union did something positive and then describes how they no longer do that unions are no longer about the protection of workers and unions are no longer required to ensure that workers have good working conditions, good wages and safe working environment.
He does that to show the story contrast between the unions then and the unions now.

Another language device can be found in lines 19 to 20 workers are not being exploited by employers, now employers are being exploited by employees, here we have a sentiencesentence with two statmentsstatements that contridictcontradict eachothereach other, the author uses that because it shows how much the situation has changed.
Brian Pollard uses all these stylistic devices to persuade the reader of his opinion, that the unions are no longer necessary.
